image.altText: Alice Springs residential property market has seen better days

props.synopsis: The NT Director of Public Prosecutions has confirmed it will not appeal the non-custodial sentence handed to a young man who fractured the skull of a nine-week-old baby in Alice Springs.

title.children: NT DPP confirms it won't appeal sentence for assault of nine-week-old baby

image.altText: A white woman, short blonde hair, wearing glasses, white blazer and blue top. Standing in front of blurred green background

props.synopsis: Northern Territory Attorney-General Marie-Clare Boothby says the changes will protect freedom of expression and religion while retaining protections against hate speech.

title.children: NT passes anti-discrimination law changes to 'restore' free speech, religion

image.altText: An Indigenous man shakes hands with King Charles in a grand hall. Other Indigenous men standing nearby.

props.synopsis: King Charles marked the major milestone in Aboriginal land rights alongside Uluru-Kata Tjuta's traditional owners.

title.children: King Charles commemorates 40th anniversary of Uluru handback

image.altText: A man with a moustache and goatee and wearing a cap standing in front of a building and smiling.

props.synopsis: Family members of Tony Rowe — who was murdered on the outskirts of Darwin in 2022 — have read emotional victim impact statements to the court ahead of killer Timothy Hunt's sentencing.

title.children: Murdered Darwin man's family describe 'massive hole' of father's absence

image.altText: A tall building of units on a suburban street.

props.synopsis: Renters and experts are calling for change in one of just two Australian jurisdictions where renters can be evicted for no reason and the only place where landlords can raise rents more than once a year.

title.children: Renters urge reform of nation's 'worst' tenancy laws in 'landlord's market'

image.altText: Three people walk across a beach on the Timor Sea

props.synopsis: Hundreds of kilometres from the nearest supermarket, Indigenous rangers in Australia's remote north are working to keep eggs on your breakfast table.

title.children: How rangers in the remote north are keeping eggs on city shelves

image.altText: A passenger yelling at a bus driver and pointing.

props.synopsis: Shocking video footage capturing the moment a bus driver was assaulted, and passengers were thrown through the air, has been played in the NT Supreme Court after the attacker pleaded guilty.

title.children: CCTV footage shows bus driver stomped on, passengers thrown to the ground

image.altText: A woman with cropped hair, wearing glasses and a serious facial expression.

props.synopsis: Three decades after the landmark Royal Commission into Aboriginal Deaths in Custody, the Northern Territory parliament rejects a motion proposing the federal government establish an independent oversight body.

title.children: Motion calling for federal oversight of NT deaths in custody rejected

image.altText: A woman holds bills in front of her and looks stern

props.synopsis: Kerrie Matthews has been forced to sell personal items to afford life-saving diabetes equipment, and with skyrocketing bills she is putting her house on the market and leaving the Northern Territory.

title.children: $5 milk and $90 rent rises: NT cost of living pushing families into housing stress

image.altText: A large LNG tank sits among mangrove trees, Darwin's skyline is visible in the background

props.synopsis: Santos's Darwin gas plant is set for a new lease of life despite a major methane leak. The company told federal officials the risk it could be forced to meet best practice on carbon emissions was "intolerable".

title.children: Prospect of net zero an 'intolerable risk' for leaking Santos plant

image.altText: A tomahawk missile fired from a US naval warship.

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump threatened to send Tomahawk missiles to Ukraine if Russia did not return to peace talks, but analysts say the long-range weapons are not the game-changer they are made out to be.

title.children: US dangled threat of Tomahawks for Ukraine, then Russia called to negotiate

image.altText: Anthony Albanese takes a selfie with a smiling Donald Trump

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese will "no doubt" use a meeting with Donald Trump next week to discuss critical minerals, the treasurer says as he dismisses a call for Australia to "decouple" with China over rare earth materials.

title.children: Chalmers says Australia can be a 'reliable' critical minerals partner with US

image.altText: Ariarne Titmus touches her hair and smiles

props.synopsis: Ariarne Titmus has spoken publicly for the first time after abruptly retiring from professional swimming at just 25, revealing the reasons behind her decision.

title.children: Titmus admits she lost the 'fire in the belly' before shock retirement

image.altText: A man in a suit with a blue tie sits inside a hall.

props.synopsis: An army colonel who seized power in a military coup has been sworn in as Madagascar's new leader, after a sudden power grab that ousted the president and sent him fleeing from the country.

title.children: Madagascar military leader sworn in as president after coup

image.altText: A police car outside National Zoo and Aquarium.

props.synopsis: Jude Wijesinghe previously pleaded guilty to stabbing his co-worker Tshewang Choden to death in the kitchen area of the National Zoo and Aquarium in Canberra, where they both worked, in 2023.

title.children: Man who murdered Canberra Zoo co-worker 'remains infatuated' with her

image.altText: A sunset view of an ocean, with a boat and still water.

props.synopsis: Unseasonable temperatures have lasted along the eastern seaboard for weeks — which has Sydney, and possibly Brisbane, on track to observe their warmest October on record.

title.children: Two of Australia's capital cities on track for warmest October on record

image.altText: A Palestinian man with a beard sits unsmiling in a chair.

props.synopsis: Shadi Abu Sido spent 18 months in Israeli detention believing that his entire family had been killed in Gaza. Then he was reunited with his wife and children in Gaza.

title.children: 'That scene was indescribable': Shadi Abu Sido returns home to Gaza after months in prison

image.altText: elderly man with white hair, busy eyebrows, white shirt, blue tie and navy jacket, gestures with hands while explaining.

props.synopsis: Known for his landmark apology for Japan's World War II aggression and the phrases "deep remorse" and "heartfelt apology", Tomiichi Murayama has died at a hospital in Oita City.

title.children: Former Japanese PM Murayama, famous for WWII apology, dies aged 101

image.altText: Male fast bowler running and pointing in celebration of a wicket

props.synopsis: Scott Boland has produced a man-of-the-match performance, bowling Victoria to a 38-run win over New South Wales in their Sheffield Shield clash.

title.children: Boland builds towards Ashes with match-winning performance for Victoria

image.altText: Donald Trump holding up a model white monument

props.synopsis: The arch would stand at the Washington end of Memorial Bridge, which spans the Potomac River from Arlington, Virginia.

title.children: Trump's plan to build Paris-style arch next to Lincoln Memorial

image.altText: A mottled frog on a green leaf

props.synopsis: Two new frog species and a banded-patterned gecko are believed to have sheltered among the boulders of Dauan, in the Torres Strait, for millions of years.

title.children: Researcher uncovers species hiding on island for thousands of years

image.altText: A man wearing a grey and black hooded jumper captured on CCTV

props.synopsis: A man who was missing in Victoria's east for more than a week is recovering in hospital after being found in bushland when he started a fire to draw attention to his location.

title.children: Missing man found alive in bushland after lighting fire to signal for help

image.altText: Two men look at a plaque, an image of the plaque is in the bottom right corner

props.synopsis: A brother of three-year-old Cheryl Grimmer, who vanished in 1970, has given the man who confessed to her killing a deadline to come forward or be named.

title.children: 'Little grub' told to come forward or be named in cold case reveal

image.altText: Ace Frehley on stage with his guitar and signature KISS makeup

props.synopsis: The original lead guitarist of the glam rock band captivated audiences with his elaborate makeup and smoke-filled guitar.

title.children: Ace Frehley, founding member of rock group KISS, dies at 74

image.altText: An older man in military uniform.

props.synopsis: Australia's defence force has had discussions with the Unted States to provide support for its Gaza peace plan but the government says no formal request has been made yet.

title.children: Defence in talks to assist Gaza peace plan but Australia says no request yet

image.altText: A screenshot of a black and white image of blazing boat on an ocean with the word 'unclassified' above it.

props.synopsis: A US strike against a suspected Venezuelan drug-smuggling vessel has left multiple survivors, as Venezuela's ambassador to the United Nations condemned the strikes as a "series of assassinations".

title.children: US strike on suspected Venezuelan drug boat 'extrajudicial executions'

image.altText: A man attempting archery on a beach

props.synopsis: An accused murderer and bikie gang member on trial in WA's Supreme Court amid heightened security is granted bail because he is unable to get access to anti-anxiety medication while bars, it is revealed.

title.children: Alleged bikie killer released on bail because prison staff wouldn't give him meds

image.altText: woman sitting at restaurant table on her phone

props.synopsis: Both people involved in a date are responsible for creating a safe environment, experts say.

title.children: How to make a first date safer and red flags to look out for

image.altText: john Bolton dressed in dark suit and red tie speaking at a lecture with pen in his right hand

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's former national security adviser has been charged with storing top secret records at home and sharing classified information. Here's what we know.

title.children: Who is John Bolton and why has he fallen out with Trump?

image.altText: Workers in hazmat suits outside a post office.

props.synopsis: Authorities are working to identify the chemical that leaked from a single package at two post offices in Queensland. Four people of the people who were taken to hospital earlier have now been discharged.

title.children: Five people taken to hospital after chemical leak in Australia Post offices

props.synopsis: There is general agreement in Labor that Jim Chalmers is the government's best communicator. But insiders watching this race know Tony Burke is the master tactician.

title.children: Race between Chalmers and Burke pits communicator against tactician

image.altText: Photo of Gus

props.synopsis: SA Police and ADF personnel have concluded a four-day renewed search for four-year-old Gus, as a missing persons advocate speaks out about the emotional impact of such cases on all families who have experienced the disappearance of a loved one.

title.children: Expanded search for Gus ends as missing persons advocate speaks out

image.altText: Australian ODI cricketer Cam Green holds the ball in both hands as he prepares to throw the ball in to the wicketkeeper.

props.synopsis: Cameron Green has been ruled out of Australia's ODI series against India, just over a month out from the start of the Ashes series against England.

title.children: Green dealt further injury setback, in-form Labuschagne into ODI squad

image.altText: A skull lies among artefacts from World War Two under the water of Chuuk Lagoon in Micronesia.

props.synopsis: The Federated States of Micronesia's biggest tourism asset has become one of its largest threats, with as much as 22 million litres of oil from World War II shipwrecks slowly leaking into the ocean.

title.children: Micronesia's worst fears realised as WWII shipwrecks leak
